void AttemptSensorFusion ( SDL_Joystick * joystick,
bool invert_sensors )
static
1149{
1150 SDL_SensorID *sensors;
1151 unsigned int i, j;
1152
1153 SDL_AssertJoysticksLocked();
1154
1155 if (!SDL_InitSubSystem(SDL_INIT_SENSOR)) {
1156 return;
1157 }
1158
1159 sensors = SDL_GetSensors(NULL);
1160 if (sensors) {
1161 for (i = 0; sensors[i]; ++i) {
1162 SDL_SensorID sensor = sensors[i];
1163
1164 if (!joystick->accel_sensor && SDL_GetSensorTypeForID(sensor) == SDL_SENSOR_ACCEL) {
1165 // Increment the sensor subsystem reference count
1166 SDL_InitSubSystem(SDL_INIT_SENSOR);
1167
1168 joystick->accel_sensor = sensor;
1169 SDL_PrivateJoystickAddSensor(joystick, SDL_SENSOR_ACCEL, 0.0f);
1170 }
1171 if (!joystick->gyro_sensor && SDL_GetSensorTypeForID(sensor) == SDL_SENSOR_GYRO) {
1172 // Increment the sensor subsystem reference count
1173 SDL_InitSubSystem(SDL_INIT_SENSOR);
1174
1175 joystick->gyro_sensor = sensor;
1176 SDL_PrivateJoystickAddSensor(joystick, SDL_SENSOR_GYRO, 0.0f);
1177 }
1178 }
1179 SDL_free(sensors);
1180 }
1181 SDL_QuitSubSystem(SDL_INIT_SENSOR);
1182
1183 /* SDL defines sensor orientation for phones relative to the natural
1184 orientation, and for gamepads relative to being held in front of you.
1185 When a phone is being used as a gamepad, its orientation changes,
1186 so adjust sensor axes to match.
1187 */
1188 if (SDL_GetNaturalDisplayOrientation(SDL_GetPrimaryDisplay()) == SDL_ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE) {
1189 /* When a device in landscape orientation is laid flat, the axes change
1190 orientation as follows:
1191 -X to +X becomes -X to +X
1192 -Y to +Y becomes +Z to -Z
1193 -Z to +Z becomes -Y to +Y
1194 */
1195 joystick->sensor_transform[0][0] = 1.0f;
1196 joystick->sensor_transform[1][2] = 1.0f;
1197 joystick->sensor_transform[2][1] = -1.0f;
1198 } else {
1199 /* When a device in portrait orientation is rotated left and laid flat,
1200 the axes change orientation as follows:
1201 -X to +X becomes +Z to -Z
1202 -Y to +Y becomes +X to -X
1203 -Z to +Z becomes -Y to +Y
1204 */
1205 joystick->sensor_transform[0][1] = -1.0f;
1206 joystick->sensor_transform[1][2] = 1.0f;
1207 joystick->sensor_transform[2][0] = -1.0f;
1208 }
1209
1210 if (invert_sensors) {
1211 for (i = 0; i < SDL_arraysize(joystick->sensor_transform); ++i) {
1212 for (j = 0; j < SDL_arraysize(joystick->sensor_transform[i]); ++j) {
1213 joystick->sensor_transform[i][j] *= -1.0f;
1214 }
1215 }
1216 }
1217}

1055 // The ROG Ally controller spoofs an Xbox 360 controller

1057 if (vendor == USB_VENDOR_MICROSOFT && product == USB_PRODUCT_XBOX360_WIRED_CONTROLLER) {

1059 bool has_ally_accel = false;

1071 if (sensor_name && SDL_strcmp(sensor_name, "Sensor BMI320 Acc") == 0) {
1072 has_ally_accel = true;
1073 }
1074 }
1075 if (!has_ally_gyro && SDL_GetSensorTypeForID(sensor) == SDL_SENSOR_GYRO) {

1081 }

1083 }

2862{
2863 SDL_GUID guid;
2864 Uint16 *guid16 = (Uint16 *)guid.data;
2865 Uint16 crc = 0;
2866
2867 SDL_zero(guid);
2868
2869 if (vendor_name && *vendor_name && product_name && *product_name) {
2870 crc = SDL_crc16(crc, vendor_name, SDL_strlen(vendor_name));
2871 crc = SDL_crc16(crc, " ", 1);
2872 crc = SDL_crc16(crc, product_name, SDL_strlen(product_name));
2873 } else if (product_name) {
2874 crc = SDL_crc16(crc, product_name, SDL_strlen(product_name));
2875 }
2876
2877 // We only need 16 bits for each of these; space them out to fill 128.
2878 // Byteswap so devices get same GUID on little/big endian platforms.
2879 *guid16++ = SDL_Swap16LE(bus);
2880 *guid16++ = SDL_Swap16LE(crc);
2881

2883 *guid16++ = SDL_Swap16LE(vendor);
2884 *guid16++ = 0;
2885 *guid16++ = SDL_Swap16LE(product);
2886 *guid16++ = 0;
2887 *guid16++ = SDL_Swap16LE(version);
2888 guid.data[14] = driver_signature;
2889 guid.data[15] = driver_data;
2890 } else {
2891 size_t available_space = sizeof(guid.data) - 4;
2892
2893 if (driver_signature) {
2894 available_space -= 2;
2895 guid.data[14] = driver_signature;
2896 guid.data[15] = driver_data;
2897 }
2898 if (product_name) {
2899 SDL_strlcpy((char *)guid16, product_name, available_space);
2900 }
2901 }
2902 return guid;

◆ SDL_GetJoystickAxis()

Sint16 SDL_GetJoystickAxis ( SDL_Joystick * joystick,
int axis )

Get the current state of an axis control on a joystick.

SDL makes no promises about what part of the joystick any given axis refers to. Your game should have some sort of configuration UI to let users specify what each axis should be bound to. Alternately, SDL's higher-level Game Controller API makes a great effort to apply order to this lower-level interface, so you know that a specific axis is the "left thumb stick," etc.

The value returned by SDL_GetJoystickAxis() is a signed integer (-32768 to 32767) representing the current position of the axis. It may be necessary to impose certain tolerances on these values to account for jitter.

Parameters
joystickan SDL_Joystick structure containing joystick information.
axisthe axis to query; the axis indices start at index 0.
Returns
a 16-bit signed integer representing the current position of the axis or 0 on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetNumJoystickAxes

1694 } else {
1695 SDL_SetError("Joystick only has %d axes", joystick->naxes);

1697 }
1698 }

1702}

◆ SDL_GetJoystickBall()

bool SDL_GetJoystickBall ( SDL_Joystick * joystick,
int ball,
int * dx,
int * dy )

Get the ball axis change since the last poll.

Trackballs can only return relative motion since the last call to SDL_GetJoystickBall(), these motion deltas are placed into dx and dy.

Most joysticks do not have trackballs.

Parameters
joystickthe SDL_Joystick to query.
ballthe ball index to query; ball indices start at index 0.
dxstores the difference in the x axis position since the last poll.
dystores the difference in the y axis position since the last poll.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also

SDL_GetJoystickGUIDForID
2789{
2790 Uint16 *guid16 = (Uint16 *)guid.data;
2791 Uint16 bus = SDL_Swap16LE(guid16[0]);
2792
2793 if ((bus < ' ' || bus == SDL_HARDWARE_BUS_VIRTUAL) && guid16[3] == 0x0000 && guid16[5] == 0x0000) {
2794 /* This GUID fits the standard form:
2795 * 16-bit bus
2796 * 16-bit CRC16 of the joystick name (can be zero)
2797 * 16-bit vendor ID
2798 * 16-bit zero
2799 * 16-bit product ID
2800 * 16-bit zero
2801 * 16-bit version
2802 * 8-bit driver identifier ('h' for HIDAPI, 'x' for XInput, etc.)
2803 * 8-bit driver-dependent type info
2804 */
2805 if (vendor) {
2806 *vendor = SDL_Swap16LE(guid16[2]);
2807 }
2808 if (product) {
2809 *product = SDL_Swap16LE(guid16[4]);
2810 }
2811 if (version) {
2812 *version = SDL_Swap16LE(guid16[6]);
2813 }
2814 if (crc16) {
2815 *crc16 = SDL_Swap16LE(guid16[1]);
2816 }
2817 } else if (bus < ' ' || bus == SDL_HARDWARE_BUS_VIRTUAL) {
2818 /* This GUID fits the unknown VID/PID form:
2819 * 16-bit bus
2820 * 16-bit CRC16 of the joystick name (can be zero)
2821 * 11 characters of the joystick name, null terminated
2822 */
2823 if (vendor) {
2824 *vendor = 0;
2825 }
2826 if (product) {
2827 *product = 0;
2828 }
2829 if (version) {
2830 *version = 0;
2831 }
2832 if (crc16) {
2833 *crc16 = SDL_Swap16LE(guid16[1]);
2834 }
2835 } else {
2836 if (vendor) {
2837 *vendor = 0;
2838 }
2839 if (product) {
2840 *product = 0;
2841 }
2842 if (version) {
2843 *version = 0;
2844 }
2845 if (crc16) {
2846 *crc16 = 0;
2847 }
2848 }
2849}

◆ SDL_GetJoystickPowerInfo()

SDL_PowerState SDL_GetJoystickPowerInfo ( SDL_Joystick * joystick,
int * percent )

Get the battery state of a joystick.

You should never take a battery status as absolute truth. Batteries (especially failing batteries) are delicate hardware, and the values reported here are best estimates based on what that hardware reports. It's not uncommon for older batteries to lose stored power much faster than it reports, or completely drain when reporting it has 20 percent left, etc.

Parameters
joystickthe joystick to query.
percenta pointer filled in with the percentage of battery life left, between 0 and 100, or NULL to ignore. This will be filled in with -1 we can't determine a value or there is no battery.
Returns
the current battery state or SDL_POWERSTATE_ERROR on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
3609{
3610 SDL_PowerState result;
3611
3612 if (percent) {
3613 *percent = -1;
3614 }
3615
3616 SDL_LockJoysticks();
3617 {
3618 CHECK_JOYSTICK_MAGIC(joystick, SDL_POWERSTATE_ERROR);
3619
3620 result = joystick->battery_state;
3621
3622 if (percent) {
3623 *percent = joystick->battery_percent;
3624 }
3625 }
3626 SDL_UnlockJoysticks();
3627
3628 return result;
3629}

◆ SDL_GetJoystickProperties()

SDL_PropertiesID SDL_GetJoystickProperties ( SDL_Joystick * joystick)

Get the properties associated with a joystick.

The following read-only properties are provided by SDL:

  • SDL_PROP_JOYSTICK_CAP_MONO_LED_BOOLEAN: true if this joystick has an LED that has adjustable brightness
  • SDL_PROP_JOYSTICK_CAP_RGB_LED_BOOLEAN: true if this joystick has an LED that has adjustable color
  • SDL_PROP_JOYSTICK_CAP_PLAYER_LED_BOOLEAN: true if this joystick has a player LED
  • SDL_PROP_JOYSTICK_CAP_RUMBLE_BOOLEAN: true if this joystick has left/right rumble
  • SDL_PROP_JOYSTICK_CAP_TRIGGER_RUMBLE_BOOLEAN: true if this joystick has simple trigger rumble
Parameters
joystickthe SDL_Joystick obtained from SDL_OpenJoystick().
Returns
a valid property ID on success or 0 on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.

◆ SDL_LockJoysticks()

void SDL_LockJoysticks ( void )

Locking for atomic access to the joystick API.

The SDL joystick functions are thread-safe, however you can lock the joysticks while processing to guarantee that the joystick list won't change and joystick and gamepad events will not be delivered.

Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.

SDL_Joystick * SDL_OpenJoystick ( SDL_JoystickID instance_id)

Open a joystick for use.

The joystick subsystem must be initialized before a joystick can be opened for use.

Parameters
instance_idthe joystick instance ID.
Returns
a joystick identifier or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.

◆ SDL_RumbleJoystick()

bool SDL_RumbleJoystick ( SDL_Joystick * joystick,
Uint16 low_frequency_rumble,
Uint16 high_frequency_rumble,
Uint32 duration_ms )

Start a rumble effect.

Each call to this function cancels any previous rumble effect, and calling it with 0 intensity stops any rumbling.

This function requires you to process SDL events or call SDL_UpdateJoysticks() to update rumble state.

Parameters
joystickthe joystick to vibrate.
low_frequency_rumblethe intensity of the low frequency (left) rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF.
high_frequency_rumblethe intensity of the high frequency (right) rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF.
duration_msthe duration of the rumble effect, in milliseconds.
Returns
true, or false if rumble isn't supported on this joystick.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
1983{
1984 bool result;
1985
1986 SDL_LockJoysticks();
1987 {
1988 CHECK_JOYSTICK_MAGIC(joystick, false);
1989
1990 if (low_frequency_rumble == joystick->low_frequency_rumble &&
1991 high_frequency_rumble == joystick->high_frequency_rumble) {
1992 // Just update the expiration
1993 result = true;
1994 } else {
1995 result = joystick->driver->Rumble(joystick, low_frequency_rumble, high_frequency_rumble);
1996 if (result) {
1997 joystick->rumble_resend = SDL_GetTicks() + SDL_RUMBLE_RESEND_MS;
1998 if (joystick->rumble_resend == 0) {
1999 joystick->rumble_resend = 1;
2000 }
2001 } else {
2002 joystick->rumble_resend = 0;
2003 }
2004 }
2005
2006 if (result) {
2007 joystick->low_frequency_rumble = low_frequency_rumble;
2008 joystick->high_frequency_rumble = high_frequency_rumble;
2009
2010 if ((low_frequency_rumble || high_frequency_rumble) && duration_ms) {
2011 joystick->rumble_expiration = SDL_GetTicks() + SDL_min(duration_ms, SDL_MAX_RUMBLE_DURATION_MS);
2012 if (!joystick->rumble_expiration) {
2013 joystick->rumble_expiration = 1;
2014 }
2015 } else {
2016 joystick->rumble_expiration = 0;
2017 joystick->rumble_resend = 0;
2018 }
2019 }
2020 }
2021 SDL_UnlockJoysticks();
2022
2023 return result;
2024}

◆ SDL_RumbleJoystickTriggers()

bool SDL_RumbleJoystickTriggers ( SDL_Joystick * joystick,
Uint16 left_rumble,
Uint16 right_rumble,
Uint32 duration_ms )

Start a rumble effect in the joystick's triggers.

Each call to this function cancels any previous trigger rumble effect, and calling it with 0 intensity stops any rumbling.

Note that this is rumbling of the triggers and not the game controller as a whole. This is currently only supported on Xbox One controllers. If you want the (more common) whole-controller rumble, use SDL_RumbleJoystick() instead.

This function requires you to process SDL events or call SDL_UpdateJoysticks() to update rumble state.

Parameters
joystickthe joystick to vibrate.
left_rumblethe intensity of the left trigger rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF.
right_rumblethe intensity of the right trigger rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF.
duration_msthe duration of the rumble effect, in milliseconds.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_RumbleJoystick

2035 // Just update the expiration

2037 } else {
2038 result = joystick->driver->RumbleTriggers(joystick, left_rumble, right_rumble);
2039 if (result) {

2041 if (joystick->trigger_rumble_resend == 0) {
2042 joystick->trigger_rumble_resend = 1;
2043 }

◆ SDL_SendJoystickAxis()

void SDL_SendJoystickAxis ( Uint64 timestamp,
SDL_Joystick * joystick,
Uint8 axis,
Sint16 value )
2436{
2437 SDL_JoystickAxisInfo *info;
2438
2439 SDL_AssertJoysticksLocked();
2440
2441 // Make sure we're not getting garbage or duplicate events
2442 if (axis >= joystick->naxes) {
2443 return;
2444 }
2445
2446 info = &joystick->axes[axis];
2447 if (!info->has_initial_value ||
2448 (!info->has_second_value && (info->initial_value <= -32767 || info->initial_value == 32767) && SDL_abs(value) < (SDL_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MAX / 4))) {
2449 info->initial_value = value;
2450 info->value = value;
2451 info->zero = value;
2452 info->has_initial_value = true;
2453 } else if (value == info->value && !info->sending_initial_value) {
2454 return;
2455 } else {
2456 info->has_second_value = true;
2457 }
2458 if (!info->sent_initial_value) {
2459 // Make sure we don't send motion until there's real activity on this axis
2460 const int MAX_ALLOWED_JITTER = SDL_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MAX / 80; // ShanWan PS3 controller needed 96
2461 if (SDL_abs(value - info->value) <= MAX_ALLOWED_JITTER &&
2462 !SDL_IsJoystickVIRTUAL(joystick->guid)) {
2463 return;
2464 }
2465 info->sent_initial_value = true;
2466 info->sending_initial_value = true;
2467 SDL_SendJoystickAxis(timestamp, joystick, axis, info->initial_value);
2468 info->sending_initial_value = false;
2469 }
2470
2471 /* We ignore events if we don't have keyboard focus, except for centering
2472 * events.
2473 */
2474 if (SDL_PrivateJoystickShouldIgnoreEvent()) {
2475 if (info->sending_initial_value ||
2476 (value > info->zero && value >= info->value) ||
2477 (value < info->zero && value <= info->value)) {
2478 return;
2479 }
2480 }
2481
2482 // Update internal joystick state
2483 SDL_assert(timestamp != 0);
2484 info->value = value;
2485 joystick->update_complete = timestamp;
2486
2487 // Post the event, if desired
2488 if (SDL_EventEnabled(SDL_EVENT_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MOTION)) {
2489 SDL_Event event;
2490 event.type = SDL_EVENT_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MOTION;
2491 event.common.timestamp = timestamp;
2492 event.jaxis.which = joystick->instance_id;
2493 event.jaxis.axis = axis;
2494 event.jaxis.value = value;
2495 SDL_PushEvent(&event);
2496 }

3650 if (!down) {
3651 if (x == 0.0f && y == 0.0f) {
3652 x = finger_info->x;
3653 y = finger_info->y;
3654 }
3655 pressure = 0.0f;
3656 }
3657

3659 x = 0.0f;
3660 } else if (x > 1.0f) {

3663 if (y < 0.0f) {

3671 pressure = 1.0f;
3672 }
3673

3676 (x == finger_info->x && y == finger_info->y && pressure == finger_info->pressure)) {
3677 return;
3678 }
3679 }

3685 } else {
3686 event_type = SDL_EVENT_GAMEPAD_TOUCHPAD_UP;
3687 }

3692 return;
3693 }
3694 }

3697 SDL_assert(timestamp != 0);
3698 finger_info->down = down;
3699 finger_info->x = x;
3700 finger_info->y = y;
3701 finger_info->pressure = pressure;
3702 joystick->update_complete = timestamp;
3703
3704 // Post the event, if desired

3706 SDL_Event event;
3707 event.type = event_type;
3708 event.common.timestamp = timestamp;
3709 event.gtouchpad.which = joystick->instance_id;

769 if (player_index >= SDL_joystick_player_count) {

773 }
774
775 SDL_joystick_players = new_players;

777 SDL_joystick_player_count = player_index + 1;

779 // Joystick is already assigned the requested player index
780 return true;

787 }
788

790 SDL_joystick_players[player_index] = instance_id;
791 }

795 driver->SetDevicePlayerIndex(device_index, player_index);
796 }
797
798 // Move any existing joystick to another slot
799 if (existing_instance > 0) {
800 SDL_SetJoystickIDForPlayerIndex(SDL_FindFreePlayerIndex(), existing_instance);

◆ SDL_SetJoystickLED()

bool SDL_SetJoystickLED ( SDL_Joystick * joystick,
Uint8 red,
Uint8 green,
Uint8 blue )

Update a joystick's LED color.

An example of a joystick LED is the light on the back of a PlayStation 4's DualShock 4 controller.

For joysticks with a single color LED, the maximum of the RGB values will be used as the LED brightness.

Parameters
joystickthe joystick to update.
redthe intensity of the red LED.
greenthe intensity of the green LED.
bluethe intensity of the blue LED.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
2067{

2074
2075 isfreshvalue = red != joystick->led_red ||
2076 green != joystick->led_green ||
2077 blue != joystick->led_blue;
2078
2079 if (isfreshvalue || SDL_GetTicks() >= joystick->led_expiration) {
2080 result = joystick->driver->SetLED(joystick, red, green, blue);
2081 joystick->led_expiration = SDL_GetTicks() + SDL_LED_MIN_REPEAT_MS;

2083 // Avoid spamming the driver

xthe x coordinate of the finger on the touchpad, normalized 0 to 1, with the origin in the upper left.
ythe y coordinate of the finger on the touchpad, normalized 0 to 1, with the origin in the upper left.
pressurethe pressure of the finger.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.

void SDL_UnlockJoysticks ( void )

Unlocking for atomic access to the joystick API.

Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
650{
651 bool last_unlock = false;
652
653 --SDL_joysticks_locked;
654
655 if (!SDL_joysticks_initialized) {
656 // NOTE: There's a small window here where another thread could lock the mutex after we've checked for pending locks
657 if (!SDL_joysticks_locked && SDL_GetAtomicInt(&SDL_joystick_lock_pending) == 0) {
658 last_unlock = true;
659 }
660 }
661
662 /* The last unlock after joysticks are uninitialized will cleanup the mutex,
663 * allowing applications to lock joysticks while reinitializing the system.
664 */
665 if (last_unlock) {
666 SDL_Mutex *joystick_lock = SDL_joystick_lock;
667
668 SDL_LockMutex(joystick_lock);
669 {
670 SDL_UnlockMutex(SDL_joystick_lock);
671
672 SDL_joystick_lock = NULL;
673 }
674 SDL_UnlockMutex(joystick_lock);
675 SDL_DestroyMutex(joystick_lock);
676 } else {
677 SDL_UnlockMutex(SDL_joystick_lock);
678 }
679}

1098
1099 // The SDL controller sensor API is only available for gamepads (at the moment)

1101 return false;
1102 }
1103

1106 return false;
1107 }

1125 return true;
1126 }

1135 SDL_strstr(joystick->name, "Kishi"))) {
1136 return true;

◆ ShouldSwapFaceButtons()

bool ShouldSwapFaceButtons ( const SDL_SteamVirtualGamepadInfo * info)
static
1248{
1249 // When "Use Nintendo Button Layout" is enabled under Steam (the default)
1250 // it will send button 0 for the A (east) button and button 1 for the
1251 // B (south) button. This is done so that games that interpret the
1252 // buttons as Xbox input will get button 0 for "A" as they expect.
1253 //
1254 // However, SDL reports positional buttons, so we need to swap
1255 // the buttons so they show up in the correct position. This provides
1256 // consistent behavior regardless of whether we're running under Steam,
1257 // under the default settings.
1258 if (info &&
1259 (info->type == SDL_GAMEPAD_TYPE_NINTENDO_SWITCH_PRO ||
1260 info->type == SDL_GAMEPAD_TYPE_NINTENDO_SWITCH_JOYCON_LEFT ||
1261 info->type == SDL_GAMEPAD_TYPE_NINTENDO_SWITCH_JOYCON_RIGHT ||
1262 info->type == SDL_GAMEPAD_TYPE_NINTENDO_SWITCH_JOYCON_PAIR)) {
1263 return true;
1264 }
1265 return false;
1266}
